Singer-turned-actor Kim Hyun-joong is considering a return to the small screen, his agency said Tuesday. According to KeyEast Entertainment, Kim recently received an offer to play the lead role in the upcoming drama series "When Time Stops", a 12-episode fantasy romance. He would play a time traveler living a solitary life. Kim has yet to decide whether to accept the offer, KeyEast said. His last screen work was the drama series "Inspiring Generation" in 2014. A former member of idol group SS501, Kim released a single in November and held fan meetings and concerts. He also recently extended his contract with the agency.

In line with the EU's 2020 strategy, which aims to reduce energy consumption by at least 20 percent by 2020, the European Commission's 2011 Energy Efficiency Plan identified buildings as having the greatest potential for energy savings. The plan focuses on mechanisms to reduce energy consumption in existing buildings - particularly in public buildings - and on the role of projects in promoting energy efficiency measures.

Voter fraud has been confirmed in several states, including Mississippi. Louisiana's chief election official is warning residents about potential scams aimed at getting their personal information after similar issues arose in several other states. The scam involves a caller claiming to work for a voter registration organization. The callers offer to register residents over the phone and in some cases, mail the voter a mail-in ballot, said Secretary of State Kyle Ardoin. According to state law, residents cannot register to vote or request a mail-in ballot over the phone.

For small businesses that sell on credit, accounts receivable can make up a significant portion of the balance sheet. During the annual audit, auditors will verify whether you can substantiate your claims about accounts receivable. These claims are known as assertions. The most common audit procedure related to accounts receivable is confirmation, where the auditor will ask your customers to confirm their account. Knowing which assertions can be proven through confirmation will help you understand why your auditor requires multiple audit procedures for the same account. Accounts receivable confirmations are primarily used to prove the existence assertion.

It happens: you hit the snooze button once, twice, and then three times, so by the time you finally shower, dress, and are ready to tackle the day, you're already running behind schedule. Often, this causes you to skip breakfast altogether. It turns out that your breakfast habit is one of the time-saving steps that shouldn't be skipped. Firstly, consuming a nutritious, high-protein, and balanced breakfast every morning is a proven way to kick-start your brain, improve concentration, and productivity. Additionally, breakfast is associated with better weight control, as it provides your body with energy and can reduce hunger later in the day.

Dublin: Lawmakers voted overwhelmingly on Friday to support Ireland's first abortion bill, legalizing the practice in exceptional cases where doctors deem a woman's life to be at risk due to her pregnancy, thus taking the first legislative step away from a blanket ban in the predominantly Catholic country. Weary lawmakers applauded the Friday vote of 127-31, while outside the parliament gates, abortion rights activists cheered, watching the outcome on their smartphones. It was the culmination of grueling debates that pitted lawmakers from Wednesday morning until 5 am Thursday and, after a sleep break, until midnight Friday.

We had the summer Olympics and the US presidential election, which every four years dominates the front pages of newspapers (and Facebook feeds!). VOLGOGRAD/GELendzhik, Russia (Reuters) - Iceland will try not to melt in the Volgograd heat when they play Nigeria in their second World Cup match on Friday after impressively drawing with two-time champions Argentina over the weekend. World Cup debutants Iceland are dreaming of the playoff stage and writing a new chapter in one of the most remarkable stories in international football in recent years. Standing in their way is not only Nigeria, who desperately need a win after losing their first match to Croatia 2-0, but also the challenge of the heat in the southern Russian city.

Two thieves from Metro Vancouver have been arrested and charged after they allegedly committed a long string of mail thefts and identity-related crimes. After the Royal Canadian Mounted Police from Coquitlam and Canada Post inspectors worked together on the mail theft investigation, investigators identified a primary suspect, made arrests, and used search warrants to seize a large quantity of evidence, according to an November 11 Royal Canadian Mounted Police Coquitlam press release. Hai Ne Hat, a 49-year-old Surrey resident well known to police, faces six charges including mail theft, unauthorized use of a postal key, as well as possession of stolen mail and a stolen credit card.

First, we looked at which major brands are the most expensive to maintain over the first 10 years of a vehicle's life. We grouped all models by brand to calculate the average cost per brand. To estimate annual maintenance costs, we determined the amount spent on every other oil change (since oil changes are typically done every six months). German imports, perhaps not surprisingly, top the list by a wide margin. Toyota and its two brands, Lexus and Scion, are among the cheapest, saving owners at least $10,000 over ten years compared to BMW.

AURORA, Illinois - A suburban teenager died after a tragic accident in a school parking lot. Police report that 17-year-old Steven Woodcock of St. Charles died Monday morning, May 16, 2016, after suffering injuries on Friday afternoon in the parking lot of Marmion Academy. According to police, the teen was riding in the passenger seat of an SUV in the parking lot when he lost his grip, according to WGN. He leaned back and hit his head on the asphalt. Police say Woodcock suffered head injuries and other damage. He was treated at the scene and then airlifted to the hospital on Monday.

Representatives of the business units of the Fijian Council of Social Services (FCOSS) approved a code of accountability for Fijian NGOs, which is to be implemented by January 2019 at a meeting in Lautoka yesterday. Representatives of the business units of the Fijian Council of Social Services (FCOSS) approved a code of accountability for Fijian NGOs, which is to be implemented by January 2019 at a meeting in Lautoka yesterday. FCOSS CEO, Vani Katanasiga, says around 50 representatives of the Divisional Councils of Social Services (DCOSS) of Lami, Suva, Nadi, Nadroga, Lautoka, Savusavu, Labasa and Rakiraki approved the code of accountability after a two-day meeting in Lautoka.

Veteran Congressman Jim Leach (R-Iowa) was defeated in 2006 in a bloody struggle. I am not a defender of "moderate Republicans," but it's worth saying that Leach, in my opinion, was undoubtedly the best Republican in the House. Nevertheless, one can only rejoice at his defeat. The fact that it happened only shows how fundamentally rotten the entire Republican party machine has become. Leach was, in many ways, a man with genuinely decent instincts and some fundamentally correct ideas about how the US should behave in the world. Nevertheless, in practice, he was useless.

Donald Trump's tweets have long raised questions about whether they violate Twitter's rules banning abusive behavior on the service. On Monday, after a Trump tweet threatened that North Korea "won't be around much longer", Twitter was forced to explain why the president wasn't blocked from the service. In a six-tweet statement from Twitter's public policy account, the company said that Twitter takes into account "newsworthiness" and "public interest" when determining whether a user has violated its rules. These factors have long been used internally by the company when deciding the fate of a problematic user, Twitter said.

No one can predict with certainty when the stock markets will end their record bull run. But the best way for investors to cope with the impending downturn is to remain calm and stick to a well-thought-out plan. The Star asked Ellie Fstein Gerstl, author of the book "30-Day Financial Detox: Take Control of Your Money, Manage Your Expenses and Eliminate Financial Stress Forever", why people find it so hard to manage their own finances - and how they can do it better. There are also other common expenses that people often overlook or accidentally misrepresent.

After the first two months of the year went largely according to plan, Summit County real estate sales experienced a downturn in March, leading to a notable decline in first-quarter numbers, according to data from Slifer Smith & Frampton. The High Country real estate giant tracks a wide range of statistics related to the local real estate market, and Summit County saw a decline of around 12 percent in both the number of real estate transactions and their total value for the first three months of 2018 compared to the first quarter of 2017, according to the company's latest market report.

Casey Brambello, a Stanhope Elmore High School student, was selected to serve on the State Department of Education's Student Advisory Council. Casey is one of 16 high school students chosen from 80 applicants. The panel reviewing student applications included representatives from ALSDE, CLAS, AASB, A+ Education Partnership, and the 2015-2016 Alabama Teacher of the Year. Students were selected based on their level of leadership in their schools and recommendations. Council members will meet twice during the school year with State Superintendent Dr. Tommy Bice.

One of the biggest questions the team faced entering spring ball remains unanswered: who will replace the linebacker? Defensive coordinator Clark Lea said that fifth-year linebacker Asmar Bilal is currently closest to being "the guy" in the unit, but seems to be in agreement with the uncertainty. He thinks the position has made big strides over the past month and a half, but is in no rush to have everything in place, as the first week of the season is still several months away.

Instead, over the weekend, he joined Tiffany Calver, host of a rap show on BBC 1Xtra, and became her co-host for the day. While he was there, he talked about a multitude of things. He reminisced about the early days of his career and even commented on rumors that he's a cultural vulture, as he appropriates British and Caribbean cultures. It's hard to overstate Amazon's success and growing power. Their market capitalization is hovering just below $1 trillion. Their growth rates have been staggering. By most estimates, Amazon now accounts for nearly 50% of all online sales in the US, around 5% of all retail sales, and significantly more than their next 10 competitors combined. One study shows that around 55% of all online product searches start on Amazon. This week's report that Amazon is considering opening up to 3,000 of its cashierless Amazon Go stores by 2021 has garnered a lot of attention, despite them having just opened their fourth location just a few days ago.

NEW YORK — A lawyer who had a meltdown towards employees of a Spanish-speaking restaurant in New York apologized on Tuesday. "To the people I offended, I apologize. Seeing myself online, I opened my eyes — the way I expressed myself is inexcusable and is not the person I am. I see that my words and actions hurt people, and for that, I am deeply sorry. While people should be given the freedom to express themselves, they should do so calmly and with respect. What the video did not convey is the real me. I am not a racist.

Some apps strive to change the world, while others are designed to bring beauty to your pocket gadget. Beautiful Clock Widgets falls into the latter category. This small Android app does exactly what it says on the label, offering a collection of clock widgets with the option to add additional data, such as local weather and battery charge information. Some of them are cool, others are funny, and a few are just weird. It's worth noting that some of them are only available in the Pro version, which costs $1.26 or the equivalent in your local currency.

It is not uncommon to read and hear complaints about the amount of waste generated by the two main parties, a phenomenon that seems to intensify during election campaigns. And yet, rarely do these two parties actively strive for genuine waste management. And by this, I mean discussion of waste in the literal sense! And yet, the problem of waste and garbage in general is one that affects us all, touching on issues of public health, social cohesion, and tourism, among others!

The city of Zamboanga - Horror has gripped the residents of Pata Island in Sulu, and it does not come from extremists, but from politicians. The residents have turned to the government for help to prevent another attack on their island community, which, according to one of them, was provoked by the residents' refusal to support the incumbent mayor, Anton Buruhan. "We are helpless," said 60-year-old Bidin Jubail, a resident of Saimbangan, one of the villages on Pata Island. Jubail recalled the attack on the island city, allegedly carried out by Buruhan's followers on January 2, who were armed with an M203 grenade launcher and M-14 and M-16 rifles.

German business optimism fell to its lowest level in more than 2.5 years in October, a sixth consecutive decline, dispelling any remaining doubts that Europe's largest economy is now mired in the euro zone debt crisis. The Munich-based Ifo research center said on Wednesday that its business climate index, based on a monthly survey of around 7,000 companies, fell from 101.4 in September to 100.0 in October. "The clouds over the German economy are darkening," said Ifo President Hans-Werner Sinn. The euro fell to a one-week low against the dollar, and European stocks turned negative after the Ifo data was released.

LOS ANGELES – An effort to grant subpoena powers to the commission that oversees the Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department will go to a vote in March 2020, after it failed to win approval from the Board of Supervisors today. Proponents of the "Los Angeles County Jail Reform" initiative gathered nearly a quarter million signatures in support of the measure, which would also give the Civilian Oversight Commission a mandate to explore reducing the number of people incarcerated in county jails and redirecting funds from jail construction to alternative sentencing measures. Supervisor Sheila Kuehl stated that more of the county's 10 million residents should have a chance to weigh in on the issue.

The Herts Baseball Club has been awarded a £10,000 grant from Sport England to open a satellite club in North West London and provide the local community with the opportunity to play baseball. The Herts Baseball Club is based at Grovehill Park in Hemel Hempstead, where it has been since its inception in 1996. The club has grown into one of the largest baseball clubs in the UK, with eight teams competing in various adult and youth leagues of the British Baseball Federation. In 2013, the club recognised that in order to accommodate the growing number of new players wanting to play baseball, the club needed to expand.

Israeli troops have wounded a Palestinian teenager at a checkpoint in the West Bank. Egypt is trying to broker a ceasefire between Israel and Hamas, the Palestinian organization that de facto controls the Gaza Strip, to avoid an escalation of violence on the Gaza border. Ottawa, March 20 (Reuters) - In the latest blow to the government of Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, a lawmaker left the ruling Liberal Party to sit as an independent on Wednesday after defending a former minister at the center of a political scandal. Trudeau has been on the defensive since February 7 over allegations that senior officials working for him pressured former Justice Minister Jody Wilson-Raybould to ensure that construction company SNC-Lavalin Group Inc avoided a trial on corruption charges. The political crisis threatens the government's chances of re-election in elections scheduled for October this year.

The Supreme Court on Friday asked the National Environmental Engineering Research Institute (NEERI) in Nagpur and the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) to consider Agra Municipal Corporation's proposal to set up a waste-to-energy plant in the city. Agra falls in the Taj Trapezium Zone, which spans around 10,400 square kilometers and includes the districts of Firozabad, Mathura, Hathras, and Etah in Uttar Pradesh and Bharatpur in Rajasthan. The Agra Municipal Corporation, a local self-government body, approached the top court seeking permission to set up the waste-to-energy plant at the Kuberpur dumping ground.

US President Donald Trump stated that his representatives would lobby Congressional leaders on the issue of building a border wall and made it clear that he would not back down from his demand for $5 billion in funding for the wall, which has led to a partial government shutdown. WASHINGTON (REUTERS) - Congressional leaders arrived at the White House on Wednesday (Jan 2) for a briefing, where President Donald Trump and representatives of the country's security services advocated for their position on the border wall issue, while he firmly stands by his demand for $5 billion (S$6.8 billion) in funding for the wall, which has led to a partial government shutdown that has already lasted 12 days.

Within two weeks, two people were bitten by rattlesnakes. The first incident occurred on April 23 on Mount Tamalpais. Then, on Friday, a teenager was allegedly bitten by a rattlesnake hatchling in the Clayton area, near Mount Diablo State Park. The Grant Bar and Grill is a lively spot where local musicians play on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday evenings, as well as Sundays during lunch on the outdoor patio. If the Old Fish House could talk, just imagine the fascinating stories it would tell about its 100 years of life by the Indian River Lagoon. It would tell us about the early days when entire families slept on their fishing boats. We would hear stories about the morning light on the river, when husbands took the same boats and joined the fishing fleet heading out to sea, while families stayed behind with wives who worked tirelessly in the fish house, processing the fish.

Washington, July 31, 2018 / 15:01. - The Washington Metropolitan Area Transit Authority (WMATA) was justified in banning the Archdiocese of Washington's religious advertising, the US Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia ruled on Tuesday. In November 2015, WMATA published 14 new guidelines for acceptable advertising on buses and trains. Section 12 explicitly prohibited "advertising that promotes or opposes any religion, religious practice or belief." These new guidelines appeared after someone attempted to purchase advertising featuring an image of Muhammad.

FORT LAUDERDALE - The Dillard High School jazz ensemble will perform on October 22 at the African American Research Library and Cultural Center in Fort Lauderdale. The concert theme is "Discovering Jazz," which traces its roots from the early 20th century to the present. The jazz ensemble, under the direction of Director Christopher Dorsey, took first place this year at the "Essentially Ellington" high school competition and festival in New York, which is the most prestigious high school jazz competition in the country. The orchestra also took first place at the Swing Central competition in Savannah, Georgia.

Maureen Wildes claims it's time to learn about the true impact of the Vietnam War on the children of veterans. Like many other children of veterans, I too am a statistic. If this study had been done many years ago when it should have been done, maybe I would have understood what was happening to me, not to mention my father. Hello, I am the wife of a Vietnam veteran, I have three daughters. My first daughter from my first marriage when I was 18, and the next two girls from my second marriage in 1970.

Albany - Governor Andrew Cuomo, who has two Twitter accounts with more than 863,000 followers, called the popular social media site an "elite bulletin board" on Tuesday and said he doesn't look at it. "We've created an echo chamber for the elite to talk to itself, and this little bubble, unrealistic world, that bans political advertising, thinks it represents the whole world," he said in an interview with WAMC radio. Cuomo has two Twitter accounts, one with 853,000 followers and another with 10,400. He said that during his campaign last year, his journalists advised him to follow events on Twitter.

Less than two years ago, I was at a South Atlantic League (Low A ball) game between the Hagerstown Suns and the visiting Greensboro Grasshoppers. Sitting behind me were two Greensboro pitchers, Trevor Richards and Ben Meyer. They were keeping a book on the game. As I mentioned in this post, neither of the pitchers seemed destined for the big leagues. As for Syria, British and American officials have suggested that the investigation at this stage may be useless, since Damascus has already managed to hide some of the evidence. What does the United Nations hope to find as a result of this investigation? What actions is the UN ready to take?

What would you give up in order to be able to choose your mobile device? Sybase, a database company currently owned by SAP, conducted a survey of 500 company employees in the US and the UK with revenues of $100 million or more. Among the questions asked was: What, if any of the following, would you be willing to give up if you were allowed to use the type of mobile device you want for work for the rest of your career? Iranian Foreign Minister Javad Zarif met with Prime Minister Imran Khan on Friday at the Prime Minister's residence, where both sides emphasized the need to develop bilateral relations in all areas of cooperation. According to Prime Minister Khan, Pakistan and Iran are key to growth and prosperity in the region through strengthening links and developing people-to-people contacts, as reported by Radio Pakistan. The Prime Minister thanked the Supreme Leader of Iran for his support for the Kashmiris' struggle for self-determination. Zarif conveyed a message from Iranian President Hassan Rouhani, inviting the Prime Minister to the upcoming Asian Cooperation Summit to be held in Iran in October this year.

Without a doubt, the addiction drama "Beautiful Boy" - not the horror film "Halloween" - is the most disturbing movie opening this week. Starring Steve Carell ("Foxcatcher") and Timothée Chalamet ("Call Me By Your Name"), the film is a mesmerizing and horrifying look at a young man's descent into methamphetamine addiction (and heroin, pills, marijuana, etc.) and a devoted father's attempts to save him. It's a true and terrifying story, so powerful that even an uninspired director and clichéd script can't diminish its impact.

Shiv Sena party's executive president Uddhav Thackeray has called on India's agriculture minister and Nationalist Congress Party leader Sharad Pawar to resign from the cabinet and come to Maharashtra to protect the interests of farmers affected by drought. After visiting the home of farmer Gajanand Gotekar, who recently committed suicide and blamed the Congress and NCP in his suicide note for the farmers' plight, Thackeray yesterday told journalists that he has called on farmers not to vote for the NCP and Congress. Uddhav met with the relatives of the deceased and, although he did not provide any immediate financial assistance, he promised to take on the educational expenses of his children.

Several recent studies have shown that patients with dementia greatly benefit from participating in art therapy. While many may think that proper nutrition and exercise are the keys to healthy aging, the International Journal of Psychogeriatrics found that certain personality traits can also have a huge impact on your life as you age. Every person has a busy life, but if you have recently moved a loved one into a nursing home or a memory care cottage, it is even more important to stay connected with them. Nutrition is important for every person, but especially for the elderly.

"Yes, it seemed the Swiss were a little shocked when I walked in," Kelly said on her Fox News program on Wednesday evening.

Incline bench training is a weight training exercise that targets the chest muscles and the front deltoid muscles. The exercise is performed by lying on an incline bench, then grasping dumbbells or a barbell over oneself and extending and flexing the elbows to lift the weight over the chest. Incline chest press machines, which mimic the movement in a fixed plane, are another way to perform the exercise. Incline bench training is one of several exercises that help create symmetry and strength in the muscles of the upper body.

The unemployment rate in Stark County fell to 6.8 percent in August, the lowest since September 2008. For the first time since 2008, the unemployment rate in Stark County dropped below 7 percent, and several factors likely contributed to the decline. The primary suspect is the influx of businesses to the area due to oil and natural gas drilling in the Utica Shale. Oil exploration companies moved into the area, followed by engineering and construction firms providing various services. The manufacturing sector also experienced growth due to increased local and national demand for steel and drilling equipment.

An American Civil Liberties Union attorney asked a federal appeals court in San Francisco to block a California law requiring police to take a DNA sample from anyone arrested on suspicion of a serious crime. LOS ANGELES (AP) - Kings forward Anze Kopitar will undergo surgery on Wednesday to repair a torn ligament in his severely sprained right ankle. An MRI on Monday confirmed that the Kings' top scorer will require corrective surgery that will keep him out of the lineup for an undetermined period. Kopitar injured the ankle when he fell awkwardly during the Kings' win over Colorado on Saturday. The Association of Korean Shipbuilders and the Shipyard Association released data confirming the expectations of many analysts: the number of active shipyards worldwide has decreased by more than 40 percent compared to what it was seven years ago. In the study, an active shipyard was understood to be one that has at least one order for shipbuilding. The number of active shipyards in China decreased from 380 to 140, and in Japan from 70 to 60 over the same period, the association reported. GENEVA – The head of the UN Fact Finding Mission on the Gaza Conflict, Judge Richard Goldstone, today called on the international community to put an end to impunity for violations of international law in Israel and the occupied Palestinian territory, as he presented the mission's report* to the Human Rights Council. After a three-month investigation, the four-member mission concluded that Israel had committed serious violations of international law in the context of its military operations in Gaza from 27 December 2008 to 18 January 2009, and that Israel had committed actions that could be qualified as war crimes, and possibly crimes against humanity.
